meanings.definition: The position or role of an instructor.
meanings.sent1: She was offered multiple instructorships at the university.
meanings.sent2: His instructorships at the school allowed him to share his knowledge with students.
meanings.sent3: The instructorships were like keys that unlocked the doors to knowledge for many.
meanings.sent4: Instructorships are the guiding stars that lead students on their educational journey.
meanings.sent5: The value of instructorships in shaping young minds cannot be overstated.

meanings.definition: The act of instructing or teaching.
meanings.sent1: Effective instructorships require clear communication and patience.
meanings.sent2: Her instructorships in math helped students understand complex problems.
meanings.sent3: The instructorships in art class sometimes involved messy paint and lots of creativity.
meanings.sent4: Instructorships are like seeds of knowledge planted in the minds of learners.
meanings.sent5: The power of instructorships lies in their ability to inspire and educate.
